resources:
iFormula Welcome To iFormula! There\'s a point at 7,000 RPMs where everything fades. The machine becomes weightless. It disappears. All that\'s left, a body moving through space, and time. At 7,000 RPM, that\'s where you meet it. That\'s where it waits for you. \nWelcome, speed enthusiast! What is F1? Driver & Teams Circuit & Schedule Gallery Calculate Learn More Race Notes Preference" About Us
1. F1 Screen Formula 1 is the world\'s highest class automobile racing sport. Drivers drive specialized race cars with advanced technology on specially designed circuits. Each season consists of a series of races (Grand Prix) in different countries. Major teams compete for two main titles: Drivers Championship and Constructors Championship. F1 is famous for its high speeds, complex race strategies and constantly evolving cutting-edge technology. It is the perfect combination of driving expertise, engine engineering and team strategy. F1 Rules General F1 rules: Each team has 2 drivers and each driver uses 1 car. Races are usually 305 km or about 2 hours Qualifying is done the day before the race to determine starting positions Drivers must change tires at least once per race Points are awarded to the first 10 drivers (25 points for the champion, 18 for second place, etc.) Fastest driver in a race gets 1 bonus point Teams can upgrade their cars throughout the season, but there are budget restrictions There are strict rules about fuel and car weight F1 cars use V6 turbo hybrid engines There are penalties for breaking rules such as starting from the pit lane or moving back several grid positions DRS (Drag Reduction System) that allows drivers to open the rear wing in certain zones if the distance with the car in front is less than 1 second, helping for overtaking. Tire Cars C1 (White Hard) - Hardest and most durable, but lowest grip C2 (Yellow Medium) - Balanced between durability and grip C3 (Red Soft) - Good grip but short life, suitable for qualifying C4 (Green Intermediate) - For semi-wet tracks C5 (Blue Wet) - For heavy rain conditions
2. Driver Screen Team and Drivers The 75th season of Formula One features 10 teams and 20 drivers competing for championship glory. Each team brings unique strengths and strategies to the grid, creating an exciting battle for both the Constructors and Drivers Championships. Mercedes-AMG Petronas F1 Team George Russell (#63) Kimi Antonelli (#12) Oracle Red Bull Racing Max Verstappen (#1) Liam Lawson (#11) Scuderia Ferrari HP Formula 1 Lewis Hamilton (#44) Charles Leclerc (#16) McLaren F1 Team Lando Norris (#4) Oscar Piastri (#81) Aston Martin Aramco F1 Team Fernando Alonso (#14) Lance Stroll (#18) Alpine F1 Team Pierre Gasly (#10) Jack Doohan (#7) Williams Racing Alexander Albon (#23) Carlos Sainz (#55) Visa Cash App RB F1 Yuki Tsunoda (#22) Isaac Hadjar (#6) Stake F1 Team Kick Sauber Gabriel Bortoleto (#5) Nico H√ºlkenberg (#27) MoneyGram Haas F1 Team Oliver Bearman (#87) Esteban Ocon (#31) These teams compete in every race to accumulate points in the Constructors Championship, while the drivers battle for the Drivers Championship title!
3. Gallery Screen Gallery %1$s 4. Calculate Screen Let\'s calculate what the average speed of the drivers is on the circuit, with lap times we can find out how fast the drivers are driving! Choose Circuit Time Lap Text must be minutes.seconds.milliseconds Invalid format. Please use m.ss.sss (e.g. 1.42.123) Calculate Output Average Speed: Fun Fact: With that speed of %s km/h, you could travel from Jakarta to Bandung in just %2$s! Share Result I reached an average speed of %1$s km/h on the %2$s circuit using the iFormula app! Share via
